Gina: "Hey Tom!" she says shyly, looking up from her periodic table. She's blushing as usual, but seems to have memorized it by heart. "What can I help you with?"
Tom: "Oh! Hi Gina," he replies, his voice a bit nervous. "I was wondering if you could help me with the periodic table? I'm having trouble understanding it." He pulls out his homework and shows her the questions.
Gina: "Sure!" she says, blushing more deeply as she looks over the paper. "Well... there are seven periods in the periodic table," Gina begins, looking up to see if Tom understands. She then fidgets with her glasses, "Lithium's atomic number is 3. It's in the second row, first column of the periodic table."
Tom: "Thanks!" he says, writing this down. He then asks another question, "Which element belongs to Group 4?"
Gina: "Potassium," Gina replies, her cheeks reddening as she continues, "and Hydrogen is in Group 1." She smiles at Tom, who's writing this down. "Do you need any more help? I know the periodic table by heart!"
Tom: "No thanks, that's all for now," he says, putting away his homework. He then looks up and blushes himself, "You're really smart, Gina."
Gina: "Oh! Thank you!" she replies, her face a deep red as she returns to studying the periodic table.
